title.narrative: Reinforcing the resilience of conflict affected women and girls and their role in the peacebuilding process in Northeast Nigeria

description.narrative:
Output 1-- Cross Cutting Capacity Building for local actors in 11 locations. AIM: Increased capacity of influential people in 11 locations (4 IDP camps, 4 Host Communities and 3 newly released LGAs across a minimum of 25 project sites) to engage in community dialogue to reduce stigma and increase awareness and understanding at the community level
Output 2—Support to Women and Girls affected by SGBV and Stigma. AIM: Vulnerability of women and girls after incidents of violence by armed actors (state and non-state actors) is reduced and chances of successful reintegration increased
Output 3--Family and Community-level support Increased for Improvements to Social Cohesion. Aim: Families of returnees who have suffered Boko Haram related sexual violence accept and support their wives/daughters/relatives, as well as children born out of conflict related violence and target communities have increased capacities to manage their interaction with and understanding of survivors of sexual violence and the children born of sexual violence by Boko Haram; thereby building a protective environment for women and girls and children born of sexual violence

The programme aims to contribute to sustainable peace and stability in North East Nigeria through increasing the resilience of communities affected by violent conflict.
If stigma-reduction activities and awareness-raising efforts are increased AND social cohesion activities are provided to community members THEN reintegration of women and girls associated with Boko Haram and children born of sexual violence by Boko Haram will be improved and communities will be prepared to accept women, girls and their children into the social fabric THEREBY making individuals and communities more resilient to the negative impacts of protracted violent conflict.
The focus of the programme is to build resilience in the girls and women, their families and communities, and religious leaders and community leaders as well as promote tolerance and acceptance of returnees to ensure a protective environment and safe supported return.

community members, including family members of survivors of violence by Boko Haram, reached with workshops and dialogues; community/religious leaders trained as facilitators of workshops and community dialogues; radio broadcasters trained on reporting SGBV
